title: The Cinema of John Sayles: Narrative, Language, Subjectivity
abstractText: This project will provide a critical overview of Sayles's fifteen 'independent' films since 1980, considering industrial, economic, social, cultural and political context and issues of authorship, independence, narrative form and style. It will also address a recurring problem in Marxist criticism. Sayles's films typically simultaneously centre the monadic bourgeois subject (they are melodramas) and decentre it (characters are convinced as complexly interwebbing intersubjectivities). This constitutes a partial, if problematic, response to 'one-sided' Marxism's failure to conceptualise the subject as anything other than the subject of capital,. Which this project will explore through phenomenological and materialistic-linguistic rather than psychoanalytical or linguistic-idealist frameworks.
organisation: University of the West of England
